Rob, is the project missing web.xml  since  the  servlet creation is also throwing NPE
no, web.xml is there; attaching a zip of the test workspace

I could not reproduce the exceptions  either from servlet  creation or from the validator.

Can you find out why ?

(I dont see any attachment here)

Created an attachment (id=42267)
zip of web project
full workspace was too large so just added the web project

this is missing from  your  org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.xml, 
putting this back will solve the  problem

  <installed facet="jst.java" version="1.5"/>
  <installed facet="jst.web" version="2.4"/>

Ok, thanks for finding that Neeraj; I agree that eliminates this particular error as a validation issue (note: would be nice if such missing facet issues generated more intelligible errors for users); the more troubling issue then is: why are these missing from org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.xml? 

Note: on restarting the workspace (and on attempting to create another dynamic web project), I'm hitting https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=142867 (did not impact facet enablement for the new project, however).
Konstantin: any thoughts on the facet issue? (have you seen this type of problem before?)

The only times I've seen such behavior is when project creation aborted with an exception. Then you would have a partially-created project with some facets missing. If you have a repro that gets into this situation without getting an error on creation then please re-open. Otherwise, this is not a framework issue.

Sending back as validation enhancement; validator should ideally handle such situations more gracefully (i.e. identify the fact that the facets are missing - which could be triggered by faulty 3rd party extensions, etc.)

Why this is just validation, validation is just exposing the problem, what about the exception when creating servlet ?


java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.eclipse.jst.servlet.ui.internal.wizard.AddServletWizard.postPerformFinish(AddServletWizard.java:107)
        at
org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.ui.DataModelWizard.performFinish(DataModelWizard.java:175)
        at

Right, it's not just validation (ideally the servlet wizard logic would also not blow up with an NPE); if we're going to try and handle this type of issue, I think the validation logic is a good place to start since problem markers about missing facets would be a good way to alert the user to the problem and give them a chance to take corrective action.

traces.message: CHKJ3008E: Missing or invalid WAR file.
